pcie.c File Reference

This file contains the device abstraction layer APIs for PCIe peripheral. More...

#include <stdint.h>
#include <ti/csl/hw_types.h>
#include <ti/csl/csl_pcie.h>
#include <ti/csl/soc.h>

Macros

#define PCIE_32BIT_BAR_SIZE   ((uint32_t)0x04U)
 BAR register offset for 32 bit.
 
#define PCIE_64BIT_BAR_SIZE   ((uint32_t)0x08U)
 BAR register offset for 64 bit.
 
#define PCIE_32BIT_ADDR_ALIGNMENT   ((uint32_t)0x3U)
 Mask for 32-bit address alignment Errata ID (i870): PCIe unaligned read access issue.

Detailed Description

This file contains the device abstraction layer APIs for PCIe peripheral.

Function Documentation

void PCIEAtuRegionConfig ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
const pcieLocationParams_t *  locationParams,
uint32_t  atuRegionIndex,
const pcieAtuRegionParams_t *  atuRegionParams 
)

Configures PCIe outbound or inbound region.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
locationParamsRefer struct pcieLocationParams_t for details
atuRegionIndexregion to be configured
  • Possible values for inbound configuration 0 to 3
  • Possible values for outbound configuration 0 to 15
atuRegionParamsATU region parameters. Values given by struct pcieAtuRegionParams_t.
Returns
None
Note
This API will configure 32-bit aligned addresses.
void PCIEBarConfig ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
const pcieLocationParams_t *  locationParams,
uint32_t  barNumber,
const pcieBarParams_t *  barParams 
)

This function configures the BAR.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
locationParamsstructure to select local or remote cfg space Refer struct pcieLocationParams_t for details.
barNumberBAR number to be configured Possible values for 32 bit BAR for RC are 0 and 1 Possible values for 32 bit BAR for EP are 0 to 5 Possible values for 64 bit BAR for RC is 0 Possible values for 64 bit BAR for EP are 0 to 2
barParamsBAR configuration parameters. Refer struct pcieBarParams_t for details
Returns
None
Note
This API should be called only after setting the PCIe device type.
void PCIEChangeLinkSpeed ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
pcieLinkSpeed_t  newSpeed 
)

This function requests the PCIe core to switch to new link speed.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
newSpeedNew speed to which the link should be switched enum pcieLinkSpeed_t for values
Returns
None
Note
This API should be called only after setting the PCIe device type.
void PCIEConfigLink ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
pcieLinkSpeed_t  maxLinkSpeed,
uint32_t  maxLinkWidth 
)

Configures maximum PCIe link speed and link width.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
maxLinkSpeedMax PCIe link speed to be set. Values given by enum pcieLinkSpeed_t
maxLinkWidthPCIe maximum link width(number of lanes). possible values: 1 or 2 for PCIeSS1 1 for PCIeSS2
Returns
None
Note
This API should be called only after setting the PCIe device type.
pcieDeviceType_t PCIEGetDeviceType ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This API returns the PCIe device type.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
Returns
deviceType PCIe device type. Refer enum pcieDeviceType_t for possible return values.
uint32_t PCIEGetDeviceVendorId ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
const pcieLocationParams_t *  locationParams 
)

This function returns the remote or local device and vendor ID.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
locationParamsstructure to select local or remote cfg space Refer struct pcieLocationParams_t for details.
Returns
deviceVendorId lower 16 bits contains vendorID Upper 16 bits contains DeviceID
Note
This API should be called only after setting the PCIe device type.
uint32_t PCIEGetLegacyIntrStatus ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
pcieLegacyIntr_t  intrAssert 
)

This function returns asserts or de-asserts legacy interrupt status.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
intrAssertAssert or de-assert legacy interrupt. Refer enum pcieLegacyIntr_t for values
Returns
status legacy interrupt assert or de-assert status
pcieLinkSpeed_t PCIEGetLinkSpeed ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

Returns the present PCIe link speed at which the PCIe is working. This API should be used after link is up.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
Returns
linkSpeed link speed at which the PCIe is working
Note
This API should be called only after setting the PCIe device type.
uint32_t PCIEGetMainIntrEnable ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function gets the status of enabled interrupts.

  • It returns 32 bit integer with bits specifying whether an interrupt is enabled or disabled.
  • Returned value can be masked with the values in enum pcieMainIntrFlag_t to check the required interrupt status
Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
Returns
status All the enabled interrupts.
uint32_t PCIEGetMsiIntrEnable ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function gets the status of enabled PCIe MSI or Legacy interrupts interrupts.

  • It returns 32 bit integer with bits specifying whether an interrupt is enabled or disabled.
  • Returned value can be masked with the values in enum pcieMsiIntrFlag_t to check the required interrupt status
Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
Returns
status All the enabled interrupt status.
uint32_t PCIEGetOutboundAddr ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function returns the PCIe outbound base address for the PCIe base address passed.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
Returns
address Outbound address for the instance passed
void PCIELegacyIntrTransmit ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
pcieLegacyIntr_t  intrAssert 
)

This function asserts or de-asserts legacy interrupt.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
intrAssertAssert or de-assert legacy interrupt. Refer enum pcieLegacyIntr_t for details
Returns
None
void PCIELtssmEnable ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  ltssmEnable 
)

This function enables link training or disables link.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
ltssmEnablelink control parameter Possible values: 1 to enable link training 0 to disable link
Returns
None

This function returns the LTSSM status.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
Returns
LTSSM status. Refer enum PCIELtssmState_t for details
void PCIEMainIntrClear ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  intrMask 
)

This Function clears the status of specified interrupts.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
intrMaskmask value for the interrupts to be cleared.
  • given by enum - pcieMainIntrFlag_t.
Returns
None
void PCIEMainIntrDisable ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  intrMask 
)

This function disables only specified PCIe interrupts.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
intrMaskmask value for the interrupts to be disabled. Supported values are given by enum pcieMainIntrFlag_t.
Returns
None
void PCIEMainIntrEnable ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  intrMask 
)

This function enables only specified PCIe interrupts.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
intrMaskMask value for the interrupts to be enabled. Supported values are given by the enum pcieMainIntrFlag_t.
Returns
None
uint32_t PCIEMainIntrRawStatus ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function returns the raw status of interrupts.

  • Returned value can be masked with the values in enum pcieMainIntrFlag_t to check the required interrupt status
Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
Returns
status all the raw interrupt status.
uint32_t PCIEMainIntrStatus ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function returns the status of interrupts.

  • It specifies whether an interrupt is active or inactive.
  • After an interrupt is serviced, the software must set to 0 the corresponding flag in the interrupt status register.
  • Returned value can be masked with the values in enum pcieMainIntrFlag_t to check the required interrupt status
Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
Returns
status all the active interrupt status.
void PCIEMsiActiveIntrClear ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  msiIntrGroup,
uint32_t  intrMask 
)

This function clears the active MSI.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
msiIntrGroupMSI interrupt group to be selected
intrMaskInterrupt mask containing active interrupts
Returns
None
uint32_t PCIEMsiActiveIntrStatus ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  msiIntrGroup 
)

This function returns the active MSI (Message signaled interrupt )interrupt status.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
msiIntrGroupMSI interrupt group to be selected
Returns
Status Status of all the active MSI interrupts
void PCIEMsiCtrl ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
const pcieLocationParams_t *  locationParams,
const pcieMsiCtrlParams_t *  msiCtrlParams 
)

This function configures MSI capabilities remote or locally.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
locationParamsstructure to select local or remote cfg space Refer struct pcieLocationParams_t for details.
msiCtrlParamsMSI control parameters. Refer struct pcieMsiCtrlParams_t for details
Returns
None
Note
This API should be called only after setting the PCIe device type.
void PCIEMsiIntrClear ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  intrMask 
)

This Function clears the status of specified PCIe MSI or Legacy interrupts.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
intrMaskmask value for the interrupts to be cleared.
  • given by enum - pcieMsiIntrFlag_t.
Returns
None
void PCIEMsiIntrCtrl ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  msiIntrNum,
uint32_t  msiIntrGroup,
uint32_t  enableMsiIntr 
)

This function enables or disables specified MSI(Message signaled interrupt).

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
msiIntrNumMSI interrupt number to be enabled or disabled Possible values: 0 to 31
msiIntrGroupMSI interrupt group to be selected Possible values: 0 to 7
enableMsiIntrenable or disable MSI Possible values: 0 to disable MSI 1 to enable MSI
Returns
None
void PCIEMsiIntrDisable ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  intrMask 
)

This function disables only specified PCIe MSI or Legacy interrupts.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
intrMaskmask value for the interrupts to be disabled. Supported values are given by enum pcieMsiIntrFlag_t.
Returns
None
void PCIEMsiIntrEnable ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
uint32_t  intrMask 
)

This function enables only specified PCIe MSI or Legacy interrupts.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
intrMaskmask value for the interrupts to be enabled. Supported values are given by the enum pcieMsiIntrFlag_t.
Returns
None
uint32_t PCIEMsiIntrRawStatus ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function returns the raw status of PCIe MSI or Legacy interrupts.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
Returns
status all the raw interrupt status.
uint32_t PCIEMsiIntrStatus ( uint32_t  baseAddr)

This function returns the status of PCIe MSI or Legacy interrupts.

  • It specifies whether an interrupt is active or inactive.
  • After an interrupt is serviced, the software must set to 0 the corresponding flag in the interrupt status register.
  • Returned value can be masked with the values in enum pcieMsiIntrFlag_t to check the required interrupt status
Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
Returns
status all the interrupt status.
void PCIEMsiMailboxConfig ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
const pcieLocationParams_t *  locationParams,
const pcieMsiMailboxParams_t *  msiMailboxParams 
)

This function configures RC's MSI mailbox or EP's MSI descriptor.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
locationParamsstructure to select local or remote cfg space Refer struct pcieLocationParams_t for details.
msiMailboxParamsmailbox parameters. Refer struct pcieMsiMailboxParams_t for details
Returns
None
Note
This API should be called only after setting the PCIe device type.
void PCIEMsiTransmit ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
pcieMsiIntrType_t  msiType,
uint32_t  msiOutboundCfgSpace 
)

This function Generate MSI using HW or SW method.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
msiTypeMSI interrupt type. Refer enum pcieMsiIntrType_t for values. After MSI generation by hardware method. API waits till MSI request is granted.
msiOutboundCfgSpaceOutbound config space from the MSI has to be generated. Used for SW MSI generation.
Returns
None
void PCIESetDeviceType ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
pcieDeviceType_t  deviceType 
)

Configures PCIe device type.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
deviceTypePCIe device type. Values given by enum pcieDeviceType_t
Returns
None
Note
This API should be called before doing other PCIe configuration.
void PCIETrafficCtrl ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
const pcieLocationParams_t *  locationParams,
const pcieTrafficCtrlParams_t *  trafficCtrlParams 
)

This function enables or disables the following local or remote traffic controls, MEM space, IO space, BUS master, SERR(System error reporting), INTX assert disable.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
locationParamsStructure to select local or remote config. Refer struct pcieLocationParams_t for details.
trafficCtrlParamsStructure containing traffic control parameters Refer struct pcieTrafficCtrlParams_t for details.
Returns
None
Note
This API should be called only after setting the PCIe device type.
void PCIETrafficStatus ( uint32_t  baseAddr,
const pcieLocationParams_t *  locationParams,
pcieTrafficCtrlParams_t *  trafficCtrlParams 
)

This function returns status of local or remote traffic control, MEM space, IO space, BUS master, SERR(System error reporting) and INTX assert disable.

Parameters
baseAddrBase Address of the PCIeSS registers.
locationParamsStructure to select local or remote config Refer struct pcieLocationParams_t for details
trafficCtrlParamsStructure containing present PCIe traffic status. Refer struct pcieTrafficCtrlParams_t for details
Returns
None
Note
This API should be called only after setting the PCIe device type.
